oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Deciphering the origin of cooperative catalysis by dirhodium acetate and chiral spiro phosphoric acid in an asymmetric amination reaction
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KISAN, HK
SUNOJ, RB
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: RHODIUM(II) AZAVINYL CARBENES
C-H FUNCTIONALIZATION
TRANSITION-METAL
INSERTION REACTION
ORGANOCATALYSIS
IMINES
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The mechanism of asymmetric amination of diazo-acetate by tertbutyl carbamate catalyzed by dirhodium tetra(trifluoro)acetate and chiral SPINOL-phosphoric acid is examined using DFT (M06 and B3LYP) computations. A cooperative participation of both catalysts is noticed in the stereo-controlling transition state of the reaction.
